title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [1 march 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [1 March 1873]
text: 28 Feb. 1873Saturday noonMy dear dear waltWalti have just got your letter the money came all safe and i have just paid louLou eddsEdd's board she is going to phelidelphaPhiladelphia to get georgeyGeorgey a hat dear waltWalt i feel as if i wanted somebody to talk tooto about poor matt i have got a letter from Jeffy a long one and one from hattyHattie Jeff gives the particulars of mattiMattyes death says he couldentcouldn't write before poor jeffJeff he feels very sad and lonesomlonesome i am glad he will keep his children with him louLou and georgeGeorge wished me to write to jeffJeff that they would take them i didentdidn't want to write it but they insisted upon it i knew waltWalt it wouldentwouldn't doodo of course but i wrote what they wished) of course they expected jeffJeff to pay a good board georgeGeorge thought louLou could manage them but walterWalter dear it would never dothey would never be satisfied to live as we doodo so its best as it is i told you i beleivebelieve georgeGeorge had bought a lot the price was 1200 he got it for 1100 hundred now if they only had money to build a house thatsthat's the talk i get quite tired of hearing of money matters somtime)sometime) i haventhaven't felt lately as if i cared much about it Lou told georgeGeorge he ought to give the house to her) poor hattieHattie she wants to see grandma so much she said grandma mama is gone i shall never see her again) poor children they will never have their loss filleddontdon't say any thing in your letter about the childrenschildren's coming herhere to live Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [1 March 1873]
